To continue, agree to our Privacy Notice.

Account not set up yet. Follow the steps in the account setup email to set up your account.

All of your devices will need to complete two-step verification to sign in to your account.
"Can't use this app with a Samsung account for business."
This device will need to complete two-step verification to sign in to your account.
To set up an authenticator app:
Use the setup key or QR code below to add Samsung account to your authenticator app.
Copy the 6-digit verification code for Samsung account from your authenticator app and return to this screen.
Enter the verification code below, then tap Verify.
Verify sign-ins by entering a code from an authenticator app.
Verify sign-ins by entering a code you get in a text message.
"Can't include your email address or phone number in your password."
"Can't include more than %d repeated or sequential characters in your password."
Use 8 or more characters with a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols.
Stay signed in on your other devices

"If you're worried that someone has your old password, then secure your account by signing out of all your other devices. Otherwise, keep them signed in to save time by not having to sign in on each device."
"If you sign out, you'll need to sign in to resume:"

Using biometrics to access banking apps
Stay signed in on your devices?
Save your changes or discard them?

Check your network connection and try again.
Trying to sign out of your account?
"The server didn't send us the content. We're working to fix this problem. Try again later."
"Enter your new email address. You'll have to sign in again after you change your address."
"You picked today as your birthday. If that's not right, then select the correct date."
"To sign in again later, you'll need to receive a verification code at the number below. If you've lost access to this number, you could be locked out of your account."
"Update your verification method now if you don't have access to this number."
Use 8 or more characters with a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols.
"Can't include your email address or phone number in your password."
"Can't include more than %d repeated or sequential characters in your password."

To continue using this service, you need to verify your identity.

Wi-Fi scanning will be turned on in Improve accuracy.

"Your new email address can't be the same as your previous email address."
"Couldn't connect to server. Check network connection and try again."
Use your fingerprints to verify your identity.
"Check your email inbox. If it's not in your inbox, check your spam folder."
"Your location information will be used in Samsung account services until it's deleted. You don't have to add a place to use your Samsung account, but it helps."
"Your location information will be used in Galaxy account services until it's deleted. You don't have to add a place to use your Galaxy account, but it helps."

"Too many verification attempts have been made, so we blocked text and voice call verification for your account.

"We'll alert you to every sign-in attempt, so you'll know as soon as someone tries to get into your account."
Your code expired. Request a new one.

Install Microsoft Authenticator before trying to add your account.
Enter the code we sent to your phone number (%s).

Enter the code we sent to your other Galaxy devices.

"Even if someone gets ahold of your password, they'll still need your device or a backup code to access your Galaxy account."

Your Galaxy account was created using your Google account, so you need to sign in with your Google account.
This phone has been locked because of an abnormal factory reset. To continue, sign in to the Samsung account you used on this phone before the reset.
This phone has been locked because of an abnormal factory reset. To continue, sign in to the Galaxy account you used on this phone before the reset.

Only someone who has created a family group can create child accounts.

"Fill in your child's name and date of birth to finish setting up their account."
The Google account you selected is already linked to another Samsung account.
"There's already a child account with that Google email address in your family group."
"You can use your child's Google Account to create a Samsung account, or use their email address instead."
"If they don't have a Galaxy phone or tablet, they can sign in or create their own Samsung account on this phone, then create an account for you in the Family menu in Samsung account settings."
Give your child the freedom to sign in to their own devices while using parental controls to protect them from harmful apps and websites.
To use their watch, your child needs a Samsung account for kids.
"You'll need your credit card to verify you're a parent. Don't worry, it won't be charged."
"To create a child account, you'll need your child's email address. You'll also need to a mobile phone number registered in your name to verify your identity."

Want a faster way to sign in?
Passkeys are a secure way of signing in to your account without entering your password. Instead, you use your fingerprint, face, or screen lock to sign in and verify your identity.

"Passkeys are a safer and easier alternative to passwords because they're unique to your account and device. They use an encrypted private key stored on your device that can't be stolen through phishing or other scams. Best of all, you don't need to remember your password anymore. You just need to verify your identity with your fingerprint, face, or screen lock."
"Samsung's passkey technology is based on the FIDO Alliance standards created with partners like Google, Apple, and Microsoft."
"Couldn't sign in with passkey. Check to make sure it's still available in your passkey manager or try another sign-in method."
